caption: A gritty blues rock track with overdriven electric guitar riffs, walking bass line, and raspy male vocals. The production features vintage tube amp warmth, Hammond organ fills, and a driving shuffle beat that captures raw emotional intensity.
lyrics:
[Intro]

[Verse 1]
Woke up this morning with the devil on my back
My woman left me and she ain't coming back
Poured myself some whiskey to ease the pain
But every drop just reminds me of her name

[Chorus]
I got the blues down in my bones
Sitting here all alone
Heartache is all I've known
I got the blues down in my bones

[Verse 2]
Worked my fingers bloody for twenty years
Gave her everything now I'm drowning in tears
She took the car and she took my pride
Left me with nothing but this pain inside

[Chorus]
I got the blues down in my bones
Sitting here all alone
Heartache is all I've known
I got the blues down in my bones

[Guitar Solo]

[Verse 3]
Sun going down on another lonely night
I'll keep on fighting till I see the light
These blues won't break me I've been here before
I'll pick myself up off this barroom floor

[Outro Chorus]
I got the blues down in my bones
But I won't stay here alone
Gonna find my way back home
I got the blues but I'll carry on
